intro: Hesperantha scopulosa, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen. Hesperantha scopulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
